channel.title: Weird crash on bm_c1a4e (with mdmp)
channel.description: Alright, after the game crashed whenever I tried to transition into c1a4e from the level before, I now got it to do at least that (I jumped down instead of using the ladder). And now, when I arrive at the bottom of the silo and get out of the water, the game crashes. But not just like that. Get this: I step out of the water, collect the shotgun ammo (or not) and turn around to go to the door... that's when it crashes. When I turn around. What. I tried walking backwards toward the door, and with that I'm indeed able to at least stand next to it. But it won't open (pressing E on the switch does nothing except the "nope." sound. You know what I mean). And in the position I was standing (left shoulder against the door, looking at the switch), I took one more step backwards... crash. It could also be that my memory is cloudy and the way further is not through the door, but through the water. So I took a dive. But as soon as I reach the position where the door is above the water: crash. Crashdump is attached. hl2_4104_crash_2012_9_18T12_30_51C0.mdmp (96.6 KB)

item.description:
Bump!

Same here. Can’t progress further in the game.

item.title: Weird crash on bm_c1a4e (with mdmp)
item.dc:creator: fr0y0
item.description:
Alright, after the game crashed whenever I tried to transition into c1a4e from the level before, I now got it to do at least that (I jumped down instead of using the ladder). And now, when I arrive at the bottom of the silo and get out of the water, the game crashes.

But not just like that.

Get this: I step out of the water, collect the shotgun ammo (or not) and turn around to go to the door… that’s when it crashes. When I turn around. What.

I tried walking backwards toward the door, and with that I’m indeed able to at least stand next to it. But it won’t open (pressing E on the switch does nothing except the “nope.” sound. You know what I mean). And in the position I was standing (left shoulder against the door, looking at the switch), I took one more step backwards… crash.

It could also be that my memory is cloudy and the way further is not through the door, but through the water. So I took a dive. But as soon as I reach the position where the door is above the water: crash.

Crashdump is attached.
hl2_4104_crash_2012_9_18T12_30_51C0.mdmp (96.6 KB)

Read full topic
